subject: Re: [junit] Reporting,trace messages, etc
msgSnippet: Regarding Question 1, I ve had great results using Log4J.  http://jakarta.apache.org/log4j/docs/index.html -- Ted Velkoff ... From: vrntech To:
messageBody:
Regarding Question 1, I've had great results using Log4J. http://jakarta.apache.org/log4j/docs/index.html

-- Ted Velkoff
----- Original Message -----
From: vrntech
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, September 27, 2002 9:55 PM
Subject: [junit] Reporting,trace messages, etc


Hello Netters,

I am starting to use JUnit and am relatively new to it. After
searching thru documentation, this news group and other sources, some
issues still remain that I hope some of you can help answer.

1. We have a need to put some trace messages in the tests so as
to know the progress of the test itself because each test can be
fairly timeconsuming. Is there a way to have these capture this
output for an individual test in the GUI-based TestRunner? I see only
thing that is captured for each test on the UI are the assertion
failures.

2. I see that JUnitReport is used quite extensively with Ant.
From what I learnt reading, it helps output TestResult in XML format
and then one can translate it using XSLT. Know how one can use that
without having to use Ant? Any resources on Net would be helpful.

3. I see JUnit is great for nesting sub-suites within a suite and
thereby creating a tree of suites. But when it comes to test results,
is there a way to get a breakup of which sub-suite had how many
failures from TestResult?


Thanks in advance,
Vern
